vulnerabilities.description_of_vuln: Reflected XSS vulnerability in the xss25 endpoint where user input is insufficiently sanitized before being reflected back in the response

semantic_details.description: The application has a blacklist-based XSS filter that can be bypassed. While it blocks some common XSS vectors like 'script', 'onload', etc., it doesn't block all possible attack vectors. The user input is directly inserted into the HTML response with insufficient sanitization.
impact: Execution of arbitrary JavaScript in victim's browser
scenario: Attacker crafts a malicious payload that bypasses the blacklist
Victim submits the form with the attacker's payload
The application reflects the payload in the response
JavaScript executes in the victim's browser context

vulnerabilities.description_of_vuln: The application explicitly disables the browser's built-in XSS protection by setting X-XSS-Protection to 0

semantic_details.description: The application explicitly disables the browser's built-in XSS protection mechanisms by setting the X-XSS-Protection header to 0, making XSS attacks more likely to succeed
impact: Increased success rate of XSS attacks
Removal of browser's built-in security protections
scenario: Browser's built-in XSS filter is disabled
XSS attacks that might have been blocked by the browser are now allowed to execute

vulnerabilities.description_of_vuln: The application creates temporary HTML files with predictable names and insufficient access controls

semantic_details.description: The application creates temporary HTML files in a publicly accessible directory with insufficient access controls and cleanup mechanisms
scenario: Application creates temporary HTML files in a static directory
Files may be accessible to other users before deletion
Race condition could allow access to files before they're deleted

vulnerabilities.description_of_vuln: The application uses PhantomJS to execute user-provided content without adequate security controls

semantic_details.description: The application uses PhantomJS to execute and validate user content, which can lead to server-side JavaScript execution vulnerabilities
scenario: Attacker provides specially crafted input that exploits PhantomJS vulnerabilities
The input is saved to a temporary file and executed by PhantomJS
Malicious code executes in the PhantomJS environment with application privileges
